intro: Varronia guazumifolia, commonly known as the Mexican soursop or Guanabana, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces a fleshy, spiny fruit that contains a milky latex and is often used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
